result.execSummary:
The defendant Davonta Cj Banks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Huber for work, school and treatment, Day Reporting Center and Electronic Monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages if applicable. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Casey H.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 53 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The last 5 months, Huber privileges for work, school and treatment, Day Reporting Center and Electronic Monitoring.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. 

Conditions of Probation to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  STRAIGHT TIME.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Casey H.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages if applicable. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.   Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

- Received and filed:   Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in custody.  James Frisch for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Davonta Cj Banks in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Davonta Cj Banks
Current: 1316 West Locust Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 09-08-2015)
Prior: 1315 West Locust Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Davonta Cj Banks not in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
